New Records: Austria conceded the fastest-ever goal in the knockout stage of a European Championship
This marked the fourth fastest goal in European Championship history
Key Match Events: Turkey scored the fastest goal in the knockout stage of a European Championship
Mert Gunok made an astonishing reflex save from Christoph Baumgartner’s header
Marcel Sabitzer was hit on the side of the head by a coin hurled from the stands
Turkey’s Salih Ozcan went over and pleaded with his team’s fans to calm down
Pre-Game Insights: Austria were expected to play with a high-pressing, front-footed style
Turkey set up to avoid falling into Ralf Rangnick’s trap by taking no chances and bypassing the press with longer balls
Post-Match Reflections: Ralf Rangnick, Austria manager: 'The four games we played were very entertaining, including today.'
Mert Gunok, Turkey goalkeeper: 'We still have a long way to go, if it’s God’s will, we will go to the very end.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was described as 'frenetic' and 'thrilling' with a 'breathless start' and 'chaotic' second half
The rain started to teem down in the second half, but the referee insisted on letting play flow wherever possible
